result.execSummary:
The defendant David Allen McHenry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees by 03-16-2018 or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs unless previously paid.
With credit for 80 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Allen McHenry

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JOC Corrected to include the warrant fee.

Defendant David Allen McHenry in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve EIGHTY (80) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for EIGHTY (80) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees BY 03-16-2018 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs UNLESS PREVIOUSLY PAID.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant David Allen McHenry in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Br. 33.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Court orders a $250.00 PR bond with turnover to JusticePoint.  

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant David Allen McHenry in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant David Allen McHenry in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Case transferred to br 6 for drug treatment court admissions on 5/6/2015 at 1:30pm.  lms

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant David Allen McHenry not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Defense is requesting a status conference; defendant has been accepted into Drug Treatment Court and is scheduled for admission on 5/6/15. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-16-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick n' Save- N. 35th St.

Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
